questions.question: What is a requirement of all marine transmitting apparatus used aboard United States vessels?
options: Only equipment that has been certified by the FCC for Part 80 operations is authorized.
Equipment must be type-accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard for maritime mobile use.
Certification is required by the International Maritime Organization (IMO).
Programming of all maritime channels must be performed by a licensed Marine Radio Operator.
questions.answer: Only equipment that has been certified by the FCC for Part 80 operations is authorized.
